Topic.Title: No worriez pumperz, tomorrow we'll be .....

Message.Msg: $5B on Wednesday... Plus, it will be EOM window dressing. Having said that, a smart institutional long would recognize that this scam's days are numbered and sell right through any POMO and any window dressing. Because this should be around 100 today. PJ, read Tim Phillips article on SA. He has now published what I figured out about a year ago. Amazon's margins are simply never going to where pumpers expect them because they do not understand that cost drivers have evolved over time in a manner that is disadvantageous to Amazon (and Amazon has amplified the issue with its indiscriminate pursuit of growth and product/category expansion regardless of underlying fundamental economics...).. Read Once_On's response to my post on Amazon's book equity change over the past two years (Once pointed out that if you included off balance sheet liabilities, Amazon's book equity would have decreased by ~$5B or roughly 2/3 of its book equity...). The folks who are taking risk are those gambling on a continued short squeeze. Any long only investor not selling through this is simply negligent. There are huge tail risks with this stock.
